result.execSummary:
The defendant Amari S Hampton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court waived all nonmandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Court ordered defendant pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges  including a DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation on 13CF5351 and 13CM5404.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive.  Consecutive to probation sentenced on 13CF5351 and 13CM5404.  FORTHWITH.    Huber privileges for work, school and Batterers Intervention program.

Court advised that under 48USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a  misdmeanor crime of domestic violence.  
Court denied request for expungement for reasons placed on the record.

records.addlTxt: Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 05/28/14. AR

Defendant Amari S Hampton in court with attorney Gabriel W Houghton.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 6 DAYS time served, with Huber privileges for work, school, and batterer's intervention program, to be served FORTHWITH. (Consecutive to Probation sentences on 13CF5351 & 13CM5404). Court WAIVED all NON-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. Court ordered defendant pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including a DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation of 13CF5351 & 13CM5404, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. Court DENIED request for expungement for reasons placed on the record.
Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Amari S Hampton in court with attorney Gabriel W Houghton.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 1 & 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Counts 1 & 2 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amari S Hampton in court with attorney Gabriel William Houghton.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for status conference with pending cases. Court GRANTED state's motion to Join 13CF5351, 13CM5404 & 14CF1019 for trial purposes. Case set for Jury Trial with pending matters on 4/21/2014. Parties request a plea hearing prior to jury trial date. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Amari S Hampton in court with attorney Gabriel William Houghton.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Case set for Status Conference with pending cases in branch 23. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Amari S Hampton in court with attorney Gabriel William Houghton.  Defendant Amari S Hampton in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 1 & 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
